title: Uhh. 14 day suspension for this?
body:
I'm a little confused, it says I have been suspended because of "abusive, player-reported comms." Here is the copied text.

Game 1
In-Game
Akrid415: i have one win in my last 9 matches in aram
Akrid415: the comps have been straight shit
Akrid415: yeah this is gonna suck. they are too tanky
Akrid415: nope
Akrid415: ?
Akrid415: nope
Akrid415: ez
Post-Game
Akrid415: %%%%%%%%%%% %%%%%%%%%%%

No previous penalties or suspensions whatsoever. This was the exact chat log from the match. What the hell is the issue here?

replies.body: Alright. Official warning time. The tone of this discussion ***on all sides*** is getting too personal. Keep things civil, everyone.

You said "ez." Someone's butt was hurt from that. Because of that hurt butt you now need to spend months and months and months grinding your honor back up, hopefully you hit 2 before season ends so you can get rewards.

Because it seems you may legitimately not be aware of the concerns around this language usage: [here's the Wikipedia link on the phrase.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ching_chong)

The opening paragraph:

>[Removed] and [removed] are pejorative terms sometimes employed by speakers of English to mock or play on the Chinese language, people of Chinese ancestry, or other East Asians perceived to be Chinese. Several public commentators have characterized the term as derogatory, noting that assaults or physical intimidation of East Asians are often accompanied by racial slurs or imitation Chinese.

Whether or not you personally intended the term in this manner, Riot -- and many other people/organizations -- consider the phrase to be a derogatory and racist comment, even out of a directly insulting context.
